summary: An author's (Timothy Gibbs) frequent sightings of the number 11 lead him to believe devilish forces are at work.

reviews.content: So bad it was funny. Must have been low budget bc the actors were crap, the plot was horrible and the props were clearly fake. If you wanna waste two hours of your life making fun of a horrible excuse for a horror movie, this is your show
For a conspiracy religious Thriller it's not one of the worst but it isn't that great either

I thought it was going to be good, but it really disapointed me, the whole thing was forced and contrite. There was no suspense and acting was awful. There is no way this was produced from the "Saw" franchise what an absolute disgrace. So for this being one horrible movie I give "11-11-11 The Prophecy"a D-.
Well, I kinda enjoy it although its narrative tone sounds a bit odd.
Pathetic. Absolutely pathetic.
Not too bad....very predictable though. I was interested enough to watch it a second time.
Load of rubbish, was bored after the first 10 minutes. Really not worth watching.
too slow to start getting interesting.  starts making you doze away
On a scary movie kick -- i guess cause Halloween is coming up... This was pretty bad though....
Great cheesey horror film with a pulse!

Oh, yes, I'm this film's main character, I lost faith because of a tragedy, but after scares an death my faith is restored, blah blah bla... I grew up in Barcelona, where everyone speaks Spanish and nobody Catalan, but all I can speak is English so I can't understand anything they tell me.. Well, except for the key people, they all like to speak English, even when talking among themselves.
My brother (who probably is the only actor capable of canveying a semblance of emotion) is a priest, and our dying father is a priest, only that none of us knows what fictional denomination of christians it may be, because sure as hell it isn't a real one.
I'm an IMF agent fot the occult, and I have been Activated... And I believe this easily, even though I'm a full-on Atheist, only because everyday has an 11:11 (not in the one at the a.m., mind you, the one at NIGHT!!!!) - by the way, is it 11:11 ET or Barcelona time?

Some cardboard and plastic mask men have been giving me cheap jump scares for a couple of days.

I know I can't suspect my brother, but I'm not in the audience, you know? They seem to have figured him out very early, but me? I have to worry about the jump-scare-guys, who're making this movie look like a carnival's hounted house.

Then Bousman gets to the last scenes, and applies the "Saw montage", where he explains what was obvious troughout the movie, and closes this turd in the stupidest way he could have thought.
Really. Is THAT bad.

Decent plot and would have been scary to be in the main actor's situation. However, it was hard to get into it and seemed a bit generic/low budget.
Ending is one of those ends where the producer grabs pieces from throughout the film and tries to make you see how you should have seen it coming.
best horror I've seen
A very dissapointing horror film,I was expecting more from my buddy Darren Lynn Bousman but he just really shit the bed here,I say SKIP IT!!!
Ultra boring. Not scary. I thought I'd give the guy who did "Repo: The Genetic Opera" a chance. Okay, no more chances, this was a complete waste of time.
Boring and confusing
Not good at all..kind of stupid actually
This was by far THE WORST MOVIE I HAVE EVER SEEN! (and I have seen a lot of movies) I don't even want to justify it with a review......by the way, DON'T WATCH IT!

This movie completely missed the mark. Take this poorly made "horror movie" with a grain of salt. as this movie has mixed 1% truth with 99% lies and trickery. It blatantly demonizes Midwayers, which are quite honestly fun loving spirits.  I implore any of you to read up on 11:11, Midwayers and Urantia. Please find your own truth about the topic.
Felt like the movie "signs" for me. This film has some scary parts but the whole movie is just boring.
Didn't think much of this, I watched it 2 weeks ago and forgot to review and now I can't remember what even happened. It was all a bit stupid, and the ending was rubbish.
the first movie in this installment was horrid. This part 2 is much much better. Things were explained and was actually scary in parts. Not bad for an Indies film.
this movie freaked me out. Loved it.

Good start all through to the middle, then gets disappointing towards the end when the mystery finally unravels. Cheaply made but could be better. Funny thing is... throughout the film I can't help thinking Timothy Gibbs face resembles that of Sean Connery in Dr.Who!

Darren Lynn Bousman from the director of Saw II, Saw III, Saw IV and Repo: The Genetic Opera brings you religion in a horror sense. What is a horror film suppose to do? It suppose to scare people, not find it annoying. Bousman writes/directs this film with no sense of scares or style by trying too hard to scare the audience.
In one word Horrible!

very bad , boring and cheap movie .. i was shocked because it is directed by the director of SAW 2,3,4
really i wasted 1.5 hour of my life ..
This Movie Had A Very Good Story & Was Very Well Directed As Well As Written. But Sadly This Movies Biggest Fault Is The God Awful Acting That Almost Ruined The Movie & Did Infact Ruin A lot Of It.

There's been an annoying trend in horror lately involving characters rediscovering their faith. It's hammered home in this tale of an impending apocalypse and the conflict between an atheist and his Christian brother. The school of "flash/screech/bang" horror is where this one pitches it's tent. Directed by Darren Lynn Bousman who gave us Saw 2, 3, and 4, but the gore is eschewed here for a brooding atmosphere which he fails to  pull off.

this movie has some good actors, but how it was shot somewhat made the acting look bad. The special effects look fake right off the back. It seemed like random stuff would be popping up out of no where. I guess the movie was supposed to be a horror film, yet it seemed like a comedy. The movie likes to bring up the 9/11 attacks n how 11 matches up with the two flights also the towers which seemed insulting.
